mapper.select: select p.productNo, p.productName, p.productcategory, countOption, p.thumbnail, c.optionPrice from product p, (select count(optionprice) countOption, min(optionPrice) optionPrice, productNo from options group by productNo)c where p.productNo = c.productNo and productCategory = #{cate}
select productNo, productName, productContent, policy, thumbnail from product where productNo = #{productNo}
select optionNo, optionName, optionPrice from options where productNo = #{productNo}

select q.qnaNo, q.productNo, q.userNo, q.productQuestion, q.productAnswer, u.email, RPAD(SUBSTR(u.email, 1, 3), LENGTH(u.email), '*') AS mskEmail, to_char(q.questionDate, 'yyyy-mm-dd') questionDate, to_char(q.answerDate, 'yyyy-mm-dd') answerDate from qna q, users u where q.userno = u.userno and productNo = #{productNo} order by qnaNo desc
mapper.insert: insert into qna values( seq_qna_no.nextval, #{productNo}, #{userNo}, #{productQuestion}, null, sysdate, null )
mapper.update: update qna set productAnswer = #{productAnswer}, answerDate = sysdate where qnaNo = #{qnaNo}
mapper.select: select o.optionNo, o.optionName, o.optionPrice, p.orderNo, p.productNo, p.userNo, p.orderQuantity, p.orderPay, to_char(p.orderDate, 'yyyy-mm-dd') orderDate, to_char(p.useDate, 'yyyy-mm-dd') useDate, to_char(p.refundDate,'yyyy-mm-dd') refundDate, p.productName, p.thumbnail from options o, (select o.orderNo, o.productNo, o.userNo, o.optionNo, o.orderQuantity, o.orderPay, o.orderDate, o.useDate, o.refundDate, p.productName, p.thumbnail from orders o, product p where o.productNo = p.productNo) p where o.optionNo = p.optionNo and userNo=#{userNo}

select o.optionNo, o.optionName, o.optionPrice, p.orderNo, p.productNo, p.userNo, p.orderQuantity, p.orderPay, p.orderDate, p.useDate, p.refundDate, p.productName, p.thumbnail from options o, (select o.orderNo, o.productNo, o.userNo, o.optionNo, o.orderQuantity, o.orderPay, o.orderDate, o.useDate, o.refundDate, p.productName, p.thumbnail from orders o, product p where o.productNo = p.productNo) p where o.optionNo = p.optionNo and userNo=#{userNo}
select productNo, productName, thumbnail from product where productNo = #{productNo}
select optionNo, optionName, optionPrice from options where optionNo = #{optionNo}
select email ,hp from users where userNo = #{userNo}
